message.content:
cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.CYBER, cs.MM, cs.SI 

The paper discusses the design and evaluation of a location-based mobile museum game, which involves human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and information retrieval (cs.IR) techniques. The use of Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technology and its potential security issues also make it relevant to the cyber security (cs.CYBER) sub-category. The game also involves multimedia (cs.MM) elements such as audio and visual cues to enhance the user experience. Finally, the paper discusses the challenges and solutions related to developing location-based experiences for public cultural spaces, which falls under the social and information sciences (cs.SI) sub-category.
